title: Keen6 ArtWork (VGA Lv1)
content:
Im sure some of you remember this pic from another thread [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] Anyway, what origionally started off as a peice of art work turned into a hoax which fooled many people [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] but anyway, i think we can all agree, i didn't do too much of a bad job [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

This image was re-made pixel by pixel in MSPaint, and then given some minor touchup's (shading) in PS. Shading was only done for the trees mostly though.

Anyway, hope you enjoy it as much as i do. I probably won't make another one of these becuase of the amount of time it takes, but if i find a really smooth CK engine with very close to origional physics, high-resolution, ill be more than happy to re-make all sprites and backgrounds for keens 4-6. Anyway, Merry Christmas, and don't forget to vote for me when the awards are up [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Oh by the way, if there really was a VGA keen, i don't think there would be this many colors. Alot of VGA dos games still look like slightly improved EGA versions (IMKO).

[img]http://img458.imageshack.us/img458/6495/egakeen1ql.png[/img]

[img]http://img385.imageshack.us/img385/9359/keen6artwork0gv.png[/img]---------
[img]http://img250.echo.cx/img250/9885/comicstrip9vf.gif[/img]

title: Nice.
content:
Good enough for me! If you had have posted it like this you would have received just as much enthusasm, I'm sure. That's some insane work right there.

Now get to remaking the rest of the graphics so we can incorporate them into z-Keen. Maybe once I get a few of my current projects out of the way, I might try my hand at it as well. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: Nice.
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]If you had have posted it like this you would have received just as much enthusasm[hr][/quote]

i like to spice things up [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] ---------
[img]http://img250.echo.cx/img250/9885/comicstrip9vf.gif[/img]

title: hmm
content: It reminds me a tiny bit of the early 90's era of SNES games, where it was all the rage to use pre-rendered graphics.  Look at Donkey Kong Country, Super Mario RPG, and a couple other games, for example.  :-)

title: Re: hmm
content: Heh, slick. I know that had to have taken a long, long time. It lost the vibrancy of the Keen series in the process, though. Nice work, but I'd suggest a little palette editing to brighten it up.

title: Re: hmm
content:
yeah, it was kinda hard to keep track of all the texture brightnesses, i tried to make it a bit darker though to keep it realistic, seeing how im not using flurecent-like-colors.---------
[img]http://img250.echo.cx/img250/9885/comicstrip9vf.gif[/img]

title: Re:
content: Looks way badass, mang. Great job.

title: Re: Re:
content:
Ah PS; is there anything you can't do? Now to incorporate that into the Keen engine...A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/lind.jpg[/img]

-Levellord

title: Re: Keen6 ArtWork (VGA Lv1)
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr] Ah PS; is there anything you can't do? Now to incorporate that into the Keen engine...[hr][/quote]

really, i wouldnt give Photo shop any credit, because all the hard work was really done in paint. If paint has brightness and contrast brushes, it would be the same really, and like i said, i only used PS so that finish look on the trees, and a tiny bit on other things, but apart from that, well... mostly hard earned labor [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dead.gif[/img]

EDIT: Wow, that made absolutely no sence did it...---------
[img]http://img250.echo.cx/img250/9885/comicstrip9vf.gif[/img]

title: Re: Keen6 ArtWork (VGA Lv1)
content:
Woah, great job! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img] For some reason I'm having a dj vu although I've never seen the picture in full size before. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img]
It's pretty good job, I'll try to remember you in the next awards. If Keen 6 had 256 colours it'd be something like that..
And yeah, if someone has time and skills, it'd be awesome to port Keen 6 with 256 colours to z-1's engine..Eat your veggies!

content:

[hr]He wouldn't, but it'd make a good start toward a remake. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: Whip.
content: That fake VGA screen really is great! If someone creates the tiles and enemies from Keen 4-6 like that, I promise that I'll alter my engine to be as close to the original games as possible, but that must be a very hard work for the brave artist. At the moment I'm happy with the engine as it is, and I don't plan to make it more similar to the originals, but to add new functionality instead. My next creature will be able to "walk" on the ceiling and on the ground as well and more. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mischief.gif[/img] [hr]The human brain is not user-friendly...
